DataElement.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL Initial Diagnosis Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the NCCN cytogenetic risk group for ALL initial diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL Initial Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A classification strategy for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) developed by NCCN that stratifies risk groups based on the cytogenetic and molecular features of ALL. (NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020):The first diagnosis of the individual's condition.

ObjectClass.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A classification strategy for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) developed by NCCN that stratifies risk groups based on the cytogenetic and molecular features of ALL. (NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL
Concepts.definition: A classification strategy for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) developed by NCCN that stratifies risk groups based on the cytogenetic and molecular features of ALL. (NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)
The first diagnosis of the individual's condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification strategy for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) developed by NCCN that stratifies risk groups based on the cytogenetic and molecular features of ALL. (NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)_A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Poor Risk

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Poor Risk
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: ALL characterized by hypoploidy (less than 44 chromosomes, KMT2A rearranged (t[4;11] or others), t(v;14q32)IgH, t(9;22)(q34;11.2): BCR-ABL1 (defined as high risk in the pre-TKI era), complex karyotype (5 or more chromosomal abnormalities), Ph-like ALL; intrachromosomal amplification of chromosome 21 (iAMP21). (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Poor Risk
Concepts.definition: ALL characterized by hypoploidy (less than 44 chromosomes, KMT2A rearranged (t[4;11] or others), t(v;14q32)IgH, t(9;22)(q34;11.2): BCR-ABL1 (defined as high risk in the pre-TKI era), complex karyotype (5 or more chromosomal abnormalities), Ph-like ALL; intrachromosomal amplification of chromosome 21 (iAMP21). (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Good Risk

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Good Risk
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: ALL characterized by hyperploidy (51-65 chromosomes or t(122;21)(p13;q22): ETV6-RUNX1. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN Cytogenetic Risk Group for ALL, Good Risk
Concepts.definition: ALL characterized by hyperploidy (51-65 chromosomes or t(122;21)(p13;q22): ETV6-RUNX1. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
